definitions.definition: A verbal form that functions as a verbal noun . (In English, a gerund has the same spelling as a present participle , but functions differently; however, this distinction may be ambiguous or unclear and so is no longer made in some modern texts such as A Comprehensive Grammar of the English Language and The Cambridge Grammar of the English Language )

In some languages such as Dutch , Italian or Russian , a verbal form similar to a present participle , but functioning as an adverb to form adverbial phrases or continuous tense. These constructions have various names besides gerund , depending on the language, such as conjunctive participles , active participles , adverbial participles , transgressives , etc.

main_definition: ( grammar ) A verbal form that functions as a verbal noun . (In English, a gerund has the same spelling as a present participle , but functions differently; however, this distinction may be ambiguous or unclear and so is no longer made in some modern texts such as A Comprehensive Grammar of the English Language and The Cambridge Grammar of the English Language )

These constructions have various names besides gerund , depending on the language, such as conjunctive participles , active participles , adverbial participles , transgressives , etc.
